paper_abstract: Data visualization is creating images that can help explain, explore, and report multivariate, multidimensional data. 1,2 Simple shapes and colors, alone or in combination, have been used by nurses to convey powerful healthcare quality information beginning with the famous Scutari pie charts of Florence Nightingale. 3,4 Today, nurses leverage computer science, statistics, and clinical expertise for visualization development and interpretation and human visual perception to identify salient (obvious) distributions, patterns, or relationships in the data. 1,2 The purpose of this article is to showcase data visualization techniques that have been used with nursing data sets to explore nursing care quality.
paper_title: Data Visualization Techniques to Showcase Nursing Care Quality
